it.unive.dais.legodroid.lib.comm

Interface Channel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BluetoothConnection.BluetoothChannel

    public interface Channel
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Classes implementing this interface represent active on-going connections between two devices. A channel object offers a higher level API than java.net.Socket, dealing with structured command and reply types rather than raw bytes. Communication is synchronous and users must be aware of the communication dynamics by calling send(Command) and receive() accordingly. Channels are also AutoCloseable, therefore losing the reference to the channel object triggers automatic disconnection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Disconnect from the device.
      Reply receive()
      Receive a Reply synchronously, i.e. this method is blocks until a reply is actually read from the channel.
      void send(Command data)
      Send a Command synchronously.

        void send(@NonNull
          Command data)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Send a Command synchronously.
        Parameters:
        data - the command to be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • receive

        @NonNull
Reply receive()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Receive a Reply synchronously, i.e. this method is blocks until a reply is actually read from the channel.
        Returns:
        the object of type Reply.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Disconnect from the device. Calling this method explicitly invalidates the object, therefore it is recommended to trigger the AutoCloseable behaviour by losing the reference to the object instead, when you need to disconnect.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.
        java.lang.Exception
